description: From Ancient Greek σελήνη (selḗnē, “moon”)  +‎ -ite; the chemistry sense comes via the name of the element selenium.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A soft, glassy form of gypsum (chemical formula CaSO4·2H2O).
(inorganic chemistry) The anion SeO32− derived from selenous acid; any salt or ester of selenous acid.
